Class TicTacToe

  • java.lang.Object
    • TicTacToe

  • public class TicTacToe
extends java.lang.Object
    TicTacToe game state. Keeps track of where pieces have been placed and who the current turn holder is.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TicTacToe() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addPiece(int row, int col)
      Add a piece to the specified (row, col) on the board; Add the specified piece to the board at the specified row,col and return true If there is already a piece at that location, do not add the piece and return false
      TicTacToe copy()
      Create a copy of this game state This allows you to modify the copy without changing this game state
      TicTacToePiece getCurrentPlayer()
      Return the current player's piece (X or O)
      java.util.List<Point> getEmptySpaces()
      Get a list of the empty spaces left on the board.
      TicTacToePiece getPiece(int row, int col)
      Get a piece from the board.
      TicTacToePiece getWinner()
      Get the winner of the game.
      boolean hasEmptySpace()
      Check if there are any empty spaces left on the board.
      boolean isGameOver()
      Check whether the game is over Return true if there is a winner or if there are no empty spaces left on the board Otherwise, return false
      void nextPlayer()
      Change the current player from X to O, or from O to X
      void setCurrentPlayer(TicTacToePiece piece)
      Set the curret players piece
      void setPiece(int row, int col, TicTacToePiece piece)
      Set the specified (row, col) to the specified piece
      java.lang.String toString()
      Output: PPP|PPP|PPP(currentPlayer) where P is either: X, O, or null

      • nextPlayer

        public void nextPlayer()
        Change the current player from X to O, or from O to X

      • addPiece

        public boolean addPiece(int row,
                        int col)
        Add a piece to the specified (row, col) on the board; Add the specified piece to the board at the specified row,col and return true If there is already a piece at that location, do not add the piece and return false
        Parameters:
        row - the row to add a piece to
        col - the col to add a piece to
        Returns:
        true if the piece was successfully added to the board

      • setPiece

        public void setPiece(int row,
                     int col,
                     TicTacToePiece piece)
        Set the specified (row, col) to the specified piece
        Parameters:
        row - the row to add a piece to
        col - the col to add a piece to
        piece - the piece to add

      • getPiece

        public TicTacToePiece getPiece(int row,
                               int col)
        Get a piece from the board. Return the piece that is located at the specified row, col If there is no piece at that location, return null
        Parameters:
        row - the row to get the piece from
        col - the col to get the piece from
        Returns:
        The piece located at (row, col)

      • hasEmptySpace

        public boolean hasEmptySpace()
        Check if there are any empty spaces left on the board. Return true if there is at least 1 empty space left on the board Return false if all spaces have a piece in them
        Returns:
        true if there are any empty (null) spaces left on the board

      • getEmptySpaces

        public java.util.List<Point> getEmptySpaces()
        Get a list of the empty spaces left on the board.
        Returns:
        a list of empty spaces. If no empty spaces, return the empty list.

      • getWinner

        public TicTacToePiece getWinner()
        Get the winner of the game. Return null if there is no winner Return the appropriate TicTacToePiece (X or Y) if there is a winner. Hint: use the helper methods: checkRowsForWinner(), checkColsForWinner(), and checkDiagsForWinner()
        Returns:
        the piece that won the game. Null if the game is not over or if there is a tie game.

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Check whether the game is over Return true if there is a winner or if there are no empty spaces left on the board Otherwise, return false
        Returns:
        true if either player has placed 3 pieces in a row, or if the board is full

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Output: PPP|PPP|PPP(currentPlayer) where P is either: X, O, or null
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
